content:
@T-compiler/meeting, I pushed a trait working group update to the compiler-team repository. This took me longer than I would like, in part because I was trying to figure out how much detail and doing other administrivia tasks, but there you have it.

@WG-compiler-traits, if you think anything is missing, please let me know and I'll amend! I apologize in advance.

@pnkfelix -- did you plan to push an update for NLL? I sigh still haven't found time to read that thread but I have a few thoughts of things I wanted to add. In particular, I wanted to put down some notes on the work that @blitzerr has been doing on closure desugaring and discuss who should work with them on it (I would love to continue doing so, but I fear I may be too inattentive)
I'll do something for the NLL update, perhaps after the meeting tonight?
oh wait, the NLL meetings are on wednesday now :face_palm:
well I will nonetheless put something up there
@nikomatsakis Good stuff. I'll try to watch that video later and get up to speed...
So I'm debating how best to confirm the agenda for the WG-checkin during the triage meeting
For this first go-round, I'm assuming we'll plan to hear from someone from NLL (e.g. me) and someone from WG-traits
@nikomatsakis should I assume you'll represent the WG-traits at the triage meeting on Thursday?
It certainly sounds like there's some shakeup going on regarding universes from what I see in the stream over in t-compiler/wg-traits

Okay. On the NLL side its not clear what the check in will look like. But even if nothing else comes up at the NLL meeting tomorrow, I think we can (should?) use whatever time is left in the NLL slot to talk about Place 2.0

anyway, I think as a matter of procedure, we should have a standard spot (presumably somewhere in the https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team repo structure) where the T-compiler meeting organizer can look to find the relevant contact from T-compiler for each WG
obviously I was able to infer it today.
maybe it can just be a table embedded in https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/blob/master/working-groups/README.md ?
